instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_FAN_0_CTL: What is SMC_FAN_0_CTL? SMC_FAN_0_CTL is a line between the SMC and the fan that controls fan speed that is frequently disturbed when someone inexperienced knocks resistors in the area off with their fingernail or screwdriver when unplugging the fan. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan not working.
threads.message:
hi guys,
                      <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan is not working . system is fully functional otherwise .  missing <SIGNAL>SMC_FAN_0_CTL</SIGNAL>  hence motor control is missing . <SIGNAL>SMC_FAN_0_CTL</SIGNAL> comes from under the smc so  kindly advise . it had liquid damage around <CHIP>U3210</CHIP> , cleaned and new <CHIP>U3210</CHIP> fitted already .  warming up near <CHIP>U3210</CHIP> brings fan to life but the fan  goes dead again after a little while . 


kindly advise

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan not working.
threads.message: Fan does not spin on these until it gets hot. This machine is fine.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan not working.
threads.message: thanks for the help and information :D.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan not working.
threads.message:
hi ,
                 went back to the machine and tested as advised . it seems it has a problem as fan does not kick in .  kindly advise 
thanks again

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan not working.
threads.message: It wont kick in until it gets hot. Unless its throttling you dont have a issue

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan not working.
threads.message: Run internal diagnostic by holding down D on startup. It will test the fan.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan not working.
